<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/24/tiktok-seen-growing-national-security-threat?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is TikTok a National Security Threat?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TikTok vs. the U.S. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxOTQ5MDY0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Wednesday, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and Sen. Tom Cotton <a href="https://www.democrats.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/10232019%20TikTok%20Letter%20-%20FINAL%20PDF.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent a letter</a> to Acting Director of National Intelligence Joseph Maguire asking him to investigate TikTok. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It wasn't because their POV vid got 102 views. They're concerned that the Chinese video app might be working with the Chinese government to a) spread disinformation b) censor content and c) harvest user data. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“TikTok is a potential counterintelligence threat we cannot ignore,” they wrote. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TikTok has racked up over 110 million downloads in the U.S. and is the reason your little cousin fell into a manhole last week. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some of TikTok’s policies do sound a lot like the Chinese government’s. </strong>The Guardian <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/sep/25/revealed-how-tiktok-censors-videos-that-do-not-please-beijing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> in September that TikTok tells its moderators to censor content about Tiananmen Square, Tibetan independence, and the religious group Falun Gong. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Earlier that month, the Washington Post </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/09/15/tiktoks-beijing-roots-fuel-censorship-suspicion-it-builds-huge-us-audience/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> that a TikTok search for info on the Hong Kong protests doesn’t turn up much. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Schumer and Cotton aren’t the first to the TikTok-bashing party</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Marco Rubio rolled up weeks ago. Earlier this month, <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/9/20906971/tiktok-censorship-china-bytedance-musically-marco-rubio-senate-mnuchin-cfius-treasury?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he asked</a> Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin to have CFIUS (pronounced “SIF-ee-yuss,” a committee that scrutinizes foreign business deals for national security issues) investigate TikTok.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Rubio </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-china-tiktok/tiktoks-musical-ly-deal-needs-u-s-national-security-review-senator-idUSKBN1WO28N?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">focused on</a></span><span> TikTok owner ByteDance’s acquisition of Musical.ly in 2017, which it then merged with TikTok. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The U.S. has been hypercritical of Chinese firms Huawei and ZTE for their close alignment with Beijing. And now, a backlash is forming against U.S. organizations (the NBA, Nike) that have recently complied with the Chinese government’s wishes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Vice President Mike Pence </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/vice-president-mike-pence-says-nba-acting-like-subsidiary-of-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blasted</a></span><span> both yesterday, saying the NBA was “acting like a wholly owned subsidiary” of the Chinese Communist Party. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">TikTok’s POV </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A U.S. crackdown isn’t the only threat. Global user downloads <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-24/chinese-owned-teen-sensation-tiktok-losing-appeal-data-shows?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped 4%</a> annually in Q3 as ByteDance dialed back its ad spend. Still...177 million first-time users signed up in the quarter, per Sensor Tower data cited by Bloomberg. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> TikTok is best known for lighthearted vids like Animojis lip syncing “Despacito.” Now it finds itself at the center of a serious international conflict. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EUROPE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/24/mario-draghi-presides-final-ecb?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Christine Lagarde Gets Out of Wearing a Halloween Costume
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Christine Lagarde talks with European Central Bank (ECB) president Mario Draghi during the "Treasury Talks" at French Economy and Finances Ministry on November 30, 2012 in Paris.' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxOTUyOTQ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ERIC PIERMONT/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Next Friday, she gets the scariest job of all when Mario Draghi <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-50020948?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ends</a> his eight-year term as European Central Bank (ECB) president. Draghi helmed his final policy meeting yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's on Lagarde's to-do list? Heading off a recession even as the EU’s most powerful economy, Germany, is sending signals it may already be in one. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In September, the ECB <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/draghi-tries-juice-european-economy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> Draghi’s plan to juice the European economy by dropping interest rates further into the negatives and resuming <span>monthly bond purchases of 20 billion euros.</span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The plan’s split the ECB. Some officials </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ecb-holds-steady-in-draghis-final-policy-decision-11571918124?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">think</a></span><span> it was sprung on them without enough time to deliberate; others fear it’s venturing into dangerous negative rate territory. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Draghi’s watch may be ending on a sour note,</strong> but his “<a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ecb-policy/never-give-up-draghi-tells-lagarde-as-he-leaves-ecb-idUSKBN1X22Q5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whatever it takes</a>” attitude in 2012 steered the eurozone out of a financial crisis.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Lagarde, the former IMF head, will review the ECB’s target numbers (like close to 2% inflation) and chart the best path to get there.</p>

<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/24/american-dream-finally-opens-nj?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Mall, a Highway, and a Swamp
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="American Dream mall in New Jersey " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxOTQ0NjkwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gary Hershorn/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It can only be New Jersey. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The $5 billion American Dream mall is expected to <a href="https://www.nj.com/bergen/2019/10/mall-of-americas-opening-was-nuts-will-american-dreams-be-the-same.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open</a> today in East Rutherford, NJ, after what felt like millennia of construction delays (well, more like 17 years). The “mall” will contain an indoor ice rink and ski area, amusement parks, and of course, loads of retail stores. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>You’ll have to wait for most of those attractions. American Dream will </span><span><a href="https://www.northjersey.com/story/news/business/2019/09/23/american-dream-mall-nj-what-open-when/2418349001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unfold</a></span><span> in four chapters, with shopping + dining arriving in March 2020. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>If this reminds you of the Mall of America in Minnesota...you might have a career in real estate. Both American Dream and the Mall of America are owned by the developer Triple Five, which <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/22/timeline-of-new-jerseys-american-dream-megamall-and-how-it-got-built.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expects</a> similar traffic at both locations—40 million visitors/year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>+ The Brew’s managing editor and proud NJ resident Neal Freyman will tell American Dream’s wild story in Light Roast, our premium Sunday newsletter. To receive Light Roast, all you need is three referrals. </em></p>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, with Fidelity<sup class="sub-text">®</sup>, there are zero account fees and zero minimums to open. Just more ways to save you money.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GIG ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/24/tip-uber-driver?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Do You Tip Your Uber Driver?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="uber tipping jar " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxOTUwMTExLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to a recent study, 60% of you answered “no.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A <a href="https://www.nber.org/papers/w26380?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working paper</a> published this week highlighted the factors that influence <strong style="color:#000">if</strong> or <strong style="color:#000">how much</strong> riders tip, including pickup times, drivers’ aggressiveness, and demographics like age or language barriers. Researchers <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/21/20925109/uber-tipping-riders-drivers-percentage-gender-nber-study?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found</a>…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Around 16% of rides were tipped.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Only 1% of riders </span><span><em>always</em></span><span> tipped.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Riders with five-star ratings tipped 2x as often and 14% more than 4.75-star riders.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Male riders were 19% more likely to tip. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/10/22/young-women-get-most-tips-regular-riders-tip-less-lessons-million-uber-trips/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sample</a> of 40+ million UberX rides is one of the largest studies of tipping behavior since the practice started in 17th century Tudor England. Note: The data is from a four-week period shortly after Uber debuted in-app tipping in 2017.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>In U.S. restaurants, a 15%–20% tip is widely understood as customary. But in growing service sectors—like ride-share, food delivery, and freelancing—tipping etiquette is less clear. Critics have complained that tipping can reinforce inequality along racial and gender lines. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Help us settle a debate:</strong> Do you tip at coffee shops? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/Ihs4JU?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Let us know here</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/24/brews-weekly-news-quiz-october-25?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
New Quiz, Who Dis
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fancy, but not fanciful. Eager, yet easy. Helpful, but not while playing Halo. It's the Brew's Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. I’m a tech entrepreneur who’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/wsj-peter-thiel-wants-get-latestage-companies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising money</a> to invest in late-stage startups. I’ve been hosting L.A. dinner parties for celebs. My fund is hosting a conference for “heretical thinkers” and “thoughtcrime.” <strong style="color:#000">Who am I? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Chipotle is ramping up its efforts to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/23/earnings-rapid-fire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outfit stores</a> with mobile pickup lanes. What are they called? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Discovery, Inc. launched <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/discovery-launches-food-network-kitchen-us?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Food Network Kitchen</a>, a streaming service featuring live cooking classes. Which fitness company did it borrow the idea from?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank: </strong>Biogen shocked the medical community by <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/biogen-shocks-medical-community-reversal-alzheimers-drug?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announcing</a> it’s bringing back a treatment for ___________ after shelving it earlier this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. This week, the CEOs of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2019/10/23/ceos-nike-armour-stepped-day?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nike</a> and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/kevin-plank-will-step-ceo-armour?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Under Armour</a> said they’re stepping down in January 2020. What are their names? (1 point for each, free running shoes for life if you can name both). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers:</strong> 1. Peter Thiel 2. Chipotlanes 3. Peloton 4. Alzheimer’s 5. Nike = Mark Parker and UA = Kevin Plank </em></sup></p>

That's put stocks within reach of all-time highs. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGEOPOLITICS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/24/tiktok-seen-growing-national-security-threat?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIs TikTok a National Security Threat?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"TikTok vs. the U.S. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxOTQ5MDY0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Wednesday, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and Sen. Tom Cotton \u003ca href=\"https://www.democrats.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/10232019%20TikTok%20Letter%20-%20FINAL%20PDF.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esent a letter\u003c/a\u003e to Acting Director of National Intelligence Joseph Maguire asking him to investigate TikTok. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt wasn't because their POV vid got 102 views. They're concerned that the Chinese video app might be working with the Chinese government to a) spread disinformation b) censor content and c) harvest user data. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“TikTok is a potential counterintelligence threat we cannot ignore,” they wrote. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTikTok has racked up over 110 million downloads in the U.S. and is the reason your little cousin fell into a manhole last week. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome of TikTok’s policies do sound a lot like the Chinese government’s. \u003c/strong\u003eThe Guardian \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/sep/25/revealed-how-tiktok-censors-videos-that-do-not-please-beijing?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e in September that TikTok tells its moderators to censor content about Tiananmen Square, Tibetan independence, and the religious group Falun Gong. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEarlier that month, the Washington Post \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/09/15/tiktoks-beijing-roots-fuel-censorship-suspicion-it-builds-huge-us-audience/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that a TikTok search for info on the Hong Kong protests doesn’t turn up much. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSchumer and Cotton aren’t the first to the TikTok-bashing party\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSen. Marco Rubio rolled up weeks ago. Earlier this month, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/9/20906971/tiktok-censorship-china-bytedance-musically-marco-rubio-senate-mnuchin-cfius-treasury?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe asked\u003c/a\u003e Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin to have CFIUS (pronounced “SIF-ee-yuss,” a committee that scrutinizes foreign business deals for national security issues) investigate TikTok.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRubio \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-china-tiktok/tiktoks-musical-ly-deal-needs-u-s-national-security-review-senator-idUSKBN1WO28N?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efocused on\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e TikTok owner ByteDance’s acquisition of Musical.ly in 2017, which it then merged with TikTok. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The U.S. has been hypercritical of Chinese firms Huawei and ZTE for their close alignment with Beijing. And now, a backlash is forming against U.S. organizations (the NBA, Nike) that have recently complied with the Chinese government’s wishes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eVice President Mike Pence \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/vice-president-mike-pence-says-nba-acting-like-subsidiary-of-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblasted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e both yesterday, saying the NBA was “acting like a wholly owned subsidiary” of the Chinese Communist Party. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTikTok’s POV \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA U.S. crackdown isn’t the only threat. Global user downloads \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-24/chinese-owned-teen-sensation-tiktok-losing-appeal-data-shows?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped 4%\u003c/a\u003e annually in Q3 as ByteDance dialed back its ad spend. Still...177 million first-time users signed up in the quarter, per Sensor Tower data cited by Bloomberg. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e TikTok is best known for lighthearted vids like Animojis lip syncing “Despacito.” Now it finds itself at the center of a serious international conflict. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNext Friday, she gets the scariest job of all when Mario Draghi \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-50020948?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eends\u003c/a\u003e his eight-year term as European Central Bank (ECB) president. Draghi helmed his final policy meeting yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat's on Lagarde's to-do list? Heading off a recession even as the EU’s most powerful economy, Germany, is sending signals it may already be in one. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn September, the ECB \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/draghi-tries-juice-european-economy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e Draghi’s plan to juice the European economy by dropping interest rates further into the negatives and resuming \u003cspan\u003emonthly bond purchases of 20 billion euros.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe plan’s split the ECB. Some officials \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ecb-holds-steady-in-draghis-final-policy-decision-11571918124?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethink\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e it was sprung on them without enough time to deliberate; others fear it’s venturing into dangerous negative rate territory. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDraghi’s watch may be ending on a sour note,\u003c/strong\u003e but his “\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ecb-policy/never-give-up-draghi-tells-lagarde-as-he-leaves-ecb-idUSKBN1X22Q5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhatever it takes\u003c/a\u003e” attitude in 2012 steered the eurozone out of a financial crisis.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eLagarde, the former IMF head, will review the ECB’s target numbers (like close to 2% inflation) and chart the best path to get there.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe $5 billion American Dream mall is expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nj.com/bergen/2019/10/mall-of-americas-opening-was-nuts-will-american-dreams-be-the-same.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopen\u003c/a\u003e today in East Rutherford, NJ, after what felt like millennia of construction delays (well, more like 17 years). The “mall” will contain an indoor ice rink and ski area, amusement parks, and of course, loads of retail stores. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYou’ll have to wait for most of those attractions. American Dream will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.northjersey.com/story/news/business/2019/09/23/american-dream-mall-nj-what-open-when/2418349001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunfold\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in four chapters, with shopping + dining arriving in March 2020. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIf this reminds you of the Mall of America in Minnesota...you might have a career in real estate. Both American Dream and the Mall of America are owned by the developer Triple Five, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/22/timeline-of-new-jerseys-american-dream-megamall-and-how-it-got-built.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpects\u003c/a\u003e similar traffic at both locations—40 million visitors/year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e+ The Brew’s managing editor and proud NJ resident Neal Freyman will tell American Dream’s wild story in Light Roast, our premium Sunday newsletter. Driver?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"uber tipping jar \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxOTUwMTExLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to a recent study, 60% of you answered “no.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://www.nber.org/papers/w26380?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking paper\u003c/a\u003e published this week highlighted the factors that influence \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eif\u003c/strong\u003e or \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ehow much\u003c/strong\u003e riders tip, including pickup times, drivers’ aggressiveness, and demographics like age or language barriers. Researchers \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/21/20925109/uber-tipping-riders-drivers-percentage-gender-nber-study?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efound\u003c/a\u003e…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAround 16% of rides were tipped.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOnly 1% of riders \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ealways\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e tipped.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRiders with five-star ratings tipped 2x as often and 14% more than 4.75-star riders.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMale riders were 19% more likely to tip. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/10/22/young-women-get-most-tips-regular-riders-tip-less-lessons-million-uber-trips/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esample\u003c/a\u003e of 40+ million UberX rides is one of the largest studies of tipping behavior since the practice started in 17th century Tudor England. Note: The data is from a four-week period shortly after Uber debuted in-app tipping in 2017.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eIn U.S. restaurants, a 15%–20% tip is widely understood as customary. But in growing service sectors—like ride-share, food delivery, and freelancing—tipping etiquette is less clear. Critics have complained that tipping can reinforce inequality along racial and gender lines. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Help us settle a debate:\u003c/strong\u003e Do you tip at coffee shops? \u003ca href=\"https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/Ihs4JU?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLet us know here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Eager, yet easy. Helpful, but not while playing Halo. It's the Brew's Weekly News Quiz. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. I’m a tech entrepreneur who’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/21/wsj-peter-thiel-wants-get-latestage-companies?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraising money\u003c/a\u003e to invest in late-stage startups. I’ve been hosting L.A. dinner parties for celebs. My fund is hosting a conference for “heretical thinkers” and “thoughtcrime.” \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho am I? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. Chipotle is ramping up its efforts to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/23/earnings-rapid-fire?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutfit stores\u003c/a\u003e with mobile pickup lanes. What are they called? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3. Discovery, Inc. launched \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/discovery-launches-food-network-kitchen-us?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFood Network Kitchen\u003c/a\u003e, a streaming service featuring live cooking classes. Which fitness company did it borrow the idea from?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e4. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFill in the blank: \u003c/strong\u003eBiogen shocked the medical community by \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/biogen-shocks-medical-community-reversal-alzheimers-drug?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannouncing\u003c/a\u003e it’s bringing back a treatment for ___________ after shelving it earlier this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e5. What are their names?
